trans-unit.source: Use the StorSimple Manager service to manage volumes
trans-unit.target: Use the StorSimple Manager service to manage volumes

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: This tutorial explains how to use the StorSimple Manager service to create and manage volumes on the StorSimple device and StorSimple virtual device.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial explains how to use the StorSimple Manager service to create and manage volumes on the StorSimple device and StorSimple virtual device.

trans-unit.source: The StorSimple Manager service is an extension of the Azure Portal that lets you manage your StorSimple solution from a single web interface.
trans-unit.target: The StorSimple Manager service is an extension of the Azure Portal that lets you manage your StorSimple solution from a single web interface.

trans-unit.source: In addition to managing volumes, you can use the StorSimple Manager service to create and manage StorSimple services, view and manage devices, view alerts, and view and manage backup policies and the backup catalog.
trans-unit.target: In addition to managing volumes, you can use the StorSimple Manager service to create and manage StorSimple services, view and manage devices, view alerts, and view and manage backup policies and the backup catalog.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Azure StorSimple can create thinly provisioned volumes only.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Azure StorSimple can create thinly provisioned volumes only.

trans-unit.source: You cannot create fully provisioned or partially provisioned volumes on an Azure StorSimple system.
trans-unit.target: You cannot create fully provisioned or partially provisioned volumes on an Azure StorSimple system.

trans-unit.source: Thin provisioning is a virtualization technology in which available storage appears to exceed physical resources.
trans-unit.target: Thin provisioning is a virtualization technology in which available storage appears to exceed physical resources.

trans-unit.source: Instead of reserving sufficient storage in advance, Azure StorSimple uses thin provisioning to allocate just enough space to meet current requirements.
trans-unit.target: Instead of reserving sufficient storage in advance, Azure StorSimple uses thin provisioning to allocate just enough space to meet current requirements.

trans-unit.source: The elastic nature of cloud storage facilitates this approach because Azure StorSimple can increase or decrease cloud storage to meet changing demands.
trans-unit.target: The elastic nature of cloud storage facilitates this approach because Azure StorSimple can increase or decrease cloud storage to meet changing demands.

trans-unit.source: The Volumes page
trans-unit.target: The Volumes page

trans-unit.source: The **Volumes** page allows you to manage the storage volumes that are provisioned on the Microsoft Azure StorSimple device for your initiators (servers).
trans-unit.target: The **Volumes** page allows you to manage the storage volumes that are provisioned on the Microsoft Azure StorSimple device for your initiators (servers).

trans-unit.source: It displays the list of volumes on your StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: It displays the list of volumes on your StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: Volumes page
trans-unit.target: Volumes page

trans-unit.source: A volume consists of a series of attributes:
trans-unit.target: A volume consists of a series of attributes:

trans-unit.source: **Name** – A descriptive name that must be unique and helps identify the volume.
trans-unit.target: **Name** – A descriptive name that must be unique and helps identify the volume.

trans-unit.source: This name is also used in monitoring reports when you filter on a specific volume.
trans-unit.target: This name is also used in monitoring reports when you filter on a specific volume.

trans-unit.source: **Status** – Can be online or offline.
trans-unit.target: **Status** – Can be online or offline.

trans-unit.source: If a volume if offline, it is not visible to initiators (servers) that are allowed access to use the volume.
trans-unit.target: If a volume if offline, it is not visible to initiators (servers) that are allowed access to use the volume.

trans-unit.source: **Capacity** – Specifies how large the volume is, as perceived by the initiator (server).
trans-unit.target: **Capacity** – Specifies how large the volume is, as perceived by the initiator (server).

trans-unit.source: Capacity specifies the total amount of data that can be stored by the initiator (server).
trans-unit.target: Capacity specifies the total amount of data that can be stored by the initiator (server).

trans-unit.source: Volumes are thinly provisioned, and data is deduplicated.
trans-unit.target: Volumes are thinly provisioned, and data is deduplicated.

trans-unit.source: This implies that your device doesn’t pre-allocate physical storage capacity internally or on the cloud according to configured volume capacity.
trans-unit.target: This implies that your device doesn’t pre-allocate physical storage capacity internally or on the cloud according to configured volume capacity.

trans-unit.source: The volume capacity is allocated and consumed on demand.
trans-unit.target: The volume capacity is allocated and consumed on demand.

trans-unit.source: **Access** – Specifies the initiators (servers) that are allowed access to this volume.
trans-unit.target: **Access** – Specifies the initiators (servers) that are allowed access to this volume.

trans-unit.source: Initiators that are not members of access control record (ACR) that is associated with the volume will not see the volume.
trans-unit.target: Initiators that are not members of access control record (ACR) that is associated with the volume will not see the volume.

trans-unit.source: **Monitoring** – Specifies whether or not a volume is being monitored.
trans-unit.target: **Monitoring** – Specifies whether or not a volume is being monitored.

trans-unit.source: A volume will have monitoring enabled by default when it is created.
trans-unit.target: A volume will have monitoring enabled by default when it is created.

trans-unit.source: Monitoring will, however, be disabled for a volume clone.
trans-unit.target: Monitoring will, however, be disabled for a volume clone.

trans-unit.source: To enable monitoring for a volume, follow the instructions in Monitor a volume.
trans-unit.target: To enable monitoring for a volume, follow the instructions in Monitor a volume.

trans-unit.source: To add a volume
trans-unit.target: To add a volume

trans-unit.source: On the **Devices** page, select the device, double-click it, and then click the **Volume Containers** tab.
trans-unit.target: On the **Devices** page, select the device, double-click it, and then click the **Volume Containers** tab.

trans-unit.source: Select a volume container and click the arrow in the corresponding row to access the volumes associated with the container.
trans-unit.target: Select a volume container and click the arrow in the corresponding row to access the volumes associated with the container.

trans-unit.source: Click **Add** at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click **Add** at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: The Add a volume wizard starts.
trans-unit.target: The Add a volume wizard starts.

trans-unit.source: Add volume wizard Basic Settings
trans-unit.target: Add volume wizard Basic Settings

trans-unit.source: In the Add a volume wizard, under **Basic Settings**, do the following:
trans-unit.target: In the Add a volume wizard, under **Basic Settings**, do the following:

trans-unit.source: Supply a **Name** for your volume.
trans-unit.target: Supply a **Name** for your volume.

trans-unit.source: Specify the **Provisioned Capacity** for your volume in GB or TB.
trans-unit.target: Specify the **Provisioned Capacity** for your volume in GB or TB.

trans-unit.source: The capacity must be between 1 GB and 64 TB for a physical device.
trans-unit.target: The capacity must be between 1 GB and 64 TB for a physical device.

trans-unit.source: The maximum capacity that can be provisioned for a volume on a StorSimple virtual device is 30 TB.
trans-unit.target: The maximum capacity that can be provisioned for a volume on a StorSimple virtual device is 30 TB.

trans-unit.source: From the drop-down list, select the **Usage Type** for your volume.
trans-unit.target: From the drop-down list, select the **Usage Type** for your volume.

trans-unit.source: Choose **Archival Volume** if you are working with less frequently accessed archival data.
trans-unit.target: Choose **Archival Volume** if you are working with less frequently accessed archival data.

trans-unit.source: For all other use cases, select **Tiered Volume**.
trans-unit.target: For all other use cases, select **Tiered Volume**.

trans-unit.source: (Tiered volumes were formerly called primary volumes.)
trans-unit.target: (Tiered volumes were formerly called primary volumes.)

trans-unit.source: Click the arrow icon ![Arrow icon](./media/storsimple-manage-volumes/HCS_ArrowIcon.png)to go to the **Additional Settings** page.
trans-unit.target: Click the arrow icon ![Arrow icon](./media/storsimple-manage-volumes/HCS_ArrowIcon.png)to go to the **Additional Settings** page.

trans-unit.source: Add Volume wizard Additional Settings
trans-unit.target: Add Volume wizard Additional Settings

trans-unit.source: Under **Additional Settings**, add a new access control record (ACR):
trans-unit.target: Under **Additional Settings**, add a new access control record (ACR):

trans-unit.source: Select an access control record (ACR) from the drop-down list.
trans-unit.target: Select an access control record (ACR) from the drop-down list.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, you can add a new ACR.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, you can add a new ACR.

trans-unit.source: ACRs determine which hosts can access your volumes by matching the host IQN with that listed in the record.
trans-unit.target: ACRs determine which hosts can access your volumes by matching the host IQN with that listed in the record.

trans-unit.source: Under **Default backup for this volume**, we recommend that you enable a default backup by selecting the **Enable** check box.
trans-unit.target: Under **Default backup for this volume**, we recommend that you enable a default backup by selecting the **Enable** check box.

trans-unit.source: Click the check icon
trans-unit.target: Click the check icon

trans-unit.source: Check icon
trans-unit.target: Check icon

trans-unit.source: to create the volume with the specified settings.
trans-unit.target: to create the volume with the specified settings.

trans-unit.source: Your new volume is now ready to use.
trans-unit.target: Your new volume is now ready to use.

trans-unit.source: Modify a volume
trans-unit.target: Modify a volume

trans-unit.source: Modify a volume when you need to expand it or change the hosts that access the volume.
trans-unit.target: Modify a volume when you need to expand it or change the hosts that access the volume.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] If you modify the volume size on the device, the volume size needs to be changed on the host as well.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] If you modify the volume size on the device, the volume size needs to be changed on the host as well.

trans-unit.source: Refer to your host operating system instructions when modifying the volume on the host.
trans-unit.target: Refer to your host operating system instructions when modifying the volume on the host.

trans-unit.source: To modify a volume
trans-unit.target: To modify a volume

trans-unit.source: On the **Devices** page, select the device, double-click it, and then click the **Volume Container** tab.
trans-unit.target: On the **Devices** page, select the device, double-click it, and then click the **Volume Container** tab.

trans-unit.source: This page lists in a tabular format all the volume containers that are associated with the device.
trans-unit.target: This page lists in a tabular format all the volume containers that are associated with the device.

trans-unit.source: Select a volume container and click it to display the list of all the volumes within the container.
trans-unit.target: Select a volume container and click it to display the list of all the volumes within the container.

trans-unit.source: On the **Volumes** page, select a volume and click **Modify**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Volumes** page, select a volume and click **Modify**.

trans-unit.source: In the Modify volume wizard, under **Basic Settings**, you can do the following:
trans-unit.target: In the Modify volume wizard, under **Basic Settings**, you can do the following:

trans-unit.source: Edit the **Name** and **Application Type**.
trans-unit.target: Edit the **Name** and **Application Type**.

trans-unit.source: Increase the **Provisioned Capacity**.
trans-unit.target: Increase the **Provisioned Capacity**.

trans-unit.source: The **Provisioned Capacity** can only be increased.
trans-unit.target: The **Provisioned Capacity** can only be increased.

trans-unit.source: You cannot shrink a volume after it is created.
trans-unit.target: You cannot shrink a volume after it is created.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] You cannot change the volume container after it is assigned to a volume.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] You cannot change the volume container after it is assigned to a volume.

trans-unit.source: Under **Additional Settings**, you can do the following:
trans-unit.target: Under **Additional Settings**, you can do the following:

trans-unit.source: Modify the ACRs, provided that the volume is offline.
trans-unit.target: Modify the ACRs, provided that the volume is offline.

trans-unit.source: If the volume is online, you will need to take it offline first.
trans-unit.target: If the volume is online, you will need to take it offline first.

trans-unit.source: Refer to the steps in [Take a volume offline](#take-a-volume-offline) prior to modifying the ACR.
trans-unit.target: Refer to the steps in [Take a volume offline](#take-a-volume-offline) prior to modifying the ACR.

trans-unit.source: Modify the list of ACRs after the volume is offline.
trans-unit.target: Modify the list of ACRs after the volume is offline.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] You cannot change the **Enable a default backup** option for the volume.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] You cannot change the **Enable a default backup** option for the volume.

trans-unit.source: Save your changes by clicking the check icon
trans-unit.target: Save your changes by clicking the check icon

trans-unit.source: check-icon
trans-unit.target: check-icon

trans-unit.source: Take a volume offline
trans-unit.target: Take a volume offline

trans-unit.source: You may need to take a volume offline when you are planning to modify it or delete it.
trans-unit.target: You may need to take a volume offline when you are planning to modify it or delete it.

trans-unit.source: When a volume is offline, it is not available for read-write access.
trans-unit.target: When a volume is offline, it is not available for read-write access.

trans-unit.source: You will need to take the volume offline on the host as well as on the device.
trans-unit.target: You will need to take the volume offline on the host as well as on the device.

trans-unit.source: Perform the following steps to take a volume offline.
trans-unit.target: Perform the following steps to take a volume offline.

trans-unit.source: To take a volume offline
trans-unit.target: To take a volume offline

trans-unit.source: Make sure that the volume in question is not in use before taking it offline.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that the volume in question is not in use before taking it offline.

trans-unit.source: Take the volume offline on the host first.
trans-unit.target: Take the volume offline on the host first.

trans-unit.source: This eliminates any potential risk of data corruption on the volume.
trans-unit.target: This eliminates any potential risk of data corruption on the volume.

trans-unit.source: For specific steps, refer to the instructions for your host operating system.
trans-unit.target: For specific steps, refer to the instructions for your host operating system.

trans-unit.source: After the host is offline, take the volume on the device offline by performing the following steps:
trans-unit.target: After the host is offline, take the volume on the device offline by performing the following steps:

trans-unit.source: On the **Devices** page, select the device, double-click it, and then click the **Volume Containers** tab.
trans-unit.target: On the **Devices** page, select the device, double-click it, and then click the **Volume Containers** tab.

trans-unit.source: The **Volume Containers** tab lists in a tabular format all the volume containers that are associated with the device.
trans-unit.target: The **Volume Containers** tab lists in a tabular format all the volume containers that are associated with the device.

trans-unit.source: Select a volume container and click it to display the list of all the volumes within the container.
trans-unit.target: Select a volume container and click it to display the list of all the volumes within the container.

trans-unit.source: Select a volume and click **Take offline**.
trans-unit.target: Select a volume and click **Take offline**.

trans-unit.source: When prompted for confirmation, click **Yes**.
trans-unit.target: When prompted for confirmation, click **Yes**.

trans-unit.source: The volume should now be offline.
trans-unit.target: The volume should now be offline.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The **Take Offline** command sends a request to the device to take the volume offline.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The **Take Offline** command sends a request to the device to take the volume offline.

trans-unit.source: If hosts are still using the volume, this results in broken connections, but taking the volume offline will not fail.
trans-unit.target: If hosts are still using the volume, this results in broken connections, but taking the volume offline will not fail.

trans-unit.source: Delete a volume
trans-unit.target: Delete a volume

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] You can delete a volume only if it is offline.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] You can delete a volume only if it is offline.

trans-unit.source: Complete the following steps to delete a volume.
trans-unit.target: Complete the following steps to delete a volume.

trans-unit.source: To delete a volume
trans-unit.target: To delete a volume

trans-unit.source: On the **Devices** page, select the device, double-click it, and then click the **Volume Containers** tab.
trans-unit.target: On the **Devices** page, select the device, double-click it, and then click the **Volume Containers** tab.

trans-unit.source: Select the volume container that has the volume you want to delete.
trans-unit.target: Select the volume container that has the volume you want to delete.

trans-unit.source: Click the volume container to access the **Volumes** page.
trans-unit.target: Click the volume container to access the **Volumes** page.

trans-unit.source: All the volumes associated with this container are displayed in a tabular format.
trans-unit.target: All the volumes associated with this container are displayed in a tabular format.

trans-unit.source: Check the status of the volume you want to delete.
trans-unit.target: Check the status of the volume you want to delete.

trans-unit.source: If the volume you want to delete is not offline, take it offline first, following the steps in [Take a volume offline](#take-a-volume-offline).
trans-unit.target: If the volume you want to delete is not offline, take it offline first, following the steps in [Take a volume offline](#take-a-volume-offline).

trans-unit.source: After the volume is offline, click **Delete** at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: After the volume is offline, click **Delete** at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: When prompted for confirmation, click **Yes**.
trans-unit.target: When prompted for confirmation, click **Yes**.

trans-unit.source: The volume will now be deleted and the **Volumes** page will show the updated list of volumes within the container.
trans-unit.target: The volume will now be deleted and the **Volumes** page will show the updated list of volumes within the container.

trans-unit.source: Monitor a volume
trans-unit.target: Monitor a volume

trans-unit.source: Volume monitoring allows you to collect I/O-related statistics for a volume.
trans-unit.target: Volume monitoring allows you to collect I/O-related statistics for a volume.

trans-unit.source: Monitoring is enabled by default for the first 32 volumes that you create.
trans-unit.target: Monitoring is enabled by default for the first 32 volumes that you create.

trans-unit.source: Monitoring of additional volumes is disabled by default.
trans-unit.target: Monitoring of additional volumes is disabled by default.

trans-unit.source: Monitoring of cloned volumes is also disabled by default.
trans-unit.target: Monitoring of cloned volumes is also disabled by default.

trans-unit.source: Perform the following steps to enable or disable monitoring for a volume.
trans-unit.target: Perform the following steps to enable or disable monitoring for a volume.

trans-unit.source: To enable or disable volume monitoring
trans-unit.target: To enable or disable volume monitoring

trans-unit.source: On the **Devices** page, select the device, double-click it, and then click the **Volume Containers** tab.
trans-unit.target: On the **Devices** page, select the device, double-click it, and then click the **Volume Containers** tab.

trans-unit.source: Select the volume container in which the volume resides, and then click the volume container to access the **Volumes** page.
trans-unit.target: Select the volume container in which the volume resides, and then click the volume container to access the **Volumes** page.

trans-unit.source: All the volumes associated with this container are listed in the tabular display.
trans-unit.target: All the volumes associated with this container are listed in the tabular display.

trans-unit.source: Click and select the volume or volume clone.
trans-unit.target: Click and select the volume or volume clone.

trans-unit.source: At the bottom of the page, click **Modify**.
trans-unit.target: At the bottom of the page, click **Modify**.

trans-unit.source: In the Modify Volume wizard, under **Basic Settings**, select **Enable** or **Disable** from the **Monitoring** drop-down list.
trans-unit.target: In the Modify Volume wizard, under **Basic Settings**, select **Enable** or **Disable** from the **Monitoring** drop-down list.
